tool.name: RECETOX apLCMS - recover weaker signals
tool.description: recover weaker signals from LC/MS spectra

configfiles.configfile: #for $infile in $ms_files ln -s '${infile}' '${infile.element_identifier}' #end for #for $infile in $extracted_files ln -s '${infile}' '${infile.element_identifier}' #end for ln -s '${corrected_file}' '${corrected_file.element_identifier}' ln -s '${aligned_file}' '${aligned_file.element_identifier}'

#set filenames_str = str("', '").join([str($f.element_identifier) for $f in $ms_files]) filenames <- c('$filenames_str')
extracted <-
corrected <- arrow::read_parquet("$parquet_file")
aligned <-
recovered <- recover_weaker_signals( cluster = cluster, filenames = filenames, extracted_features = extracted, corrected_features = corrected, aligned_rt_crosstab = aligned$rt_crosstab, aligned_int_crosstab = aligned$int_crosstab, original_mz_tolerance = mz_tol, aligned_mz_tolerance = aligned$mz_tolerance, aligned_rt_tolerance = aligned$rt_tolerance, mz_range = recover_mz_range, rt_range = recover_chr_range, use_observed_range = use_observed_range, min_bandwidth = min_bandwidth, max_bandwidth = max_bandwidth, recover_min_count = recover_min_count )
df <- as.data.frame(aligned) arrow::write_parquet(df, "$aligned_feature_sample_table")

param.name: ms_files
param.label: Input data
param.help: Mass spectrometry file for peak extraction.

param.name: extracted_files
param.label: Input extracted feature samples
param.help: Mass spectrometry files containing feature samples.

param.name: corrected_file
param.label: Input corrected feature samples
param.help: Mass spectrometry file containing corrected feature samples.

param.name: aligned_file
param.label: Input aligned feature samples
param.help: Mass spectrometry file containing aligned feature samples.

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: mz_tol
param.help: The m/z tolerance level for the grouping of data points. This value is expressed as the fraction of the m/z value. This value, multiplied by the m/z value, becomes the cutoff level. The recommended value is the machine's nominal accuracy level. Divide the ppm value by 1e6. For FTMS, 1e-5 is recommended.

param.name: min_exp
param.label: min_exp
param.help: If a feature is to be included in the final feature table, it must be present in at least this number of spectra.

tool.help:
This is a tool which runs apLCMS alignment of features.
